quoteFirst: For instance, the plumule of Tropaeolum majus (see former Fig. 175) moved towards the dim evening light in a slightly zigzag line until 6.45 P.M., it then returned on its course until
quoteLast: , during which time it zigzagged and described an ellipse of considerable size. The hypocotyl of Brassica oleracea (see former Fig. 173) moved in a straight line to the light until 5.15 P.M., and then from the light, making in its backward course a great rectangular bend, and then returned for a short distance towards the former source of the light; no observations were made after 7.10 P.M., but during the night it recovered its vertical position.
title: The Power of Movement in Plants
author: Darwin, Charles, 1809-1882; Darwin, Francis, Sir, 1848-1925

quoteLast: . Also it was absurd for Lyndhurst to say that he was past the age when “dressing up” is seemly. quoteFirst: The meeting of the Ways and Means Committee which had been called for a quarter past ten was of more than local importance. It was of national importance as the Mayor was careful to inform its members, among whom were the picked brains of the community, when he informally opened the business. But it was not until
quoteLast: that he was able to do so. It was not that the Committee itself was unpunctual; it was simply that one and all had seen that morning's _Tribune_ and that the common task had perforce to yield for the nonce to their hearty congratulations.

quoteFirst: Hermann walked backwards and forwards; then coming to a lamp he looked at his watch. It was
quoteLast: . Leaning against the lamp-post, his eyes fixed on the long hand of his watch, he counted impatiently the minutes which had yet to pass.
